noun.description: A colorless, odorless reactive gas, the chemical element of atomic number 8 and the life-supporting component of the air.
examples: if breathing stops, there is no oxygen getting to the brain and the cells begin to die
hydrogen and carbon in the fuel combine with the oxygen in the air to form carbon dioxide and water

origin: Late 18th century: from French ( principe) oxygène acidifying constituent (because at first it was held to be the essential component in the formation of acids).
